messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: finding unschoolers
messages.msgSnippet: ... so many of us. **Yes, we do!  My kids are missing unschoolers very much since the conference (and I am too).  We don t know ANY near us.  We ll drive
messages.messageBody:
>> We really need to do a southern New England unschool day since there are
so many of us.

**Yes, we do! My kids are missing unschoolers very much since the
conference (and I am too). We don't know ANY near us. We'll drive wherever
to see you guys. ~Rue


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Happy Thanksgiving
messages.msgSnippet: I know most of you are in the U.S. and some in other places, but it is Thanksgiving in Canada and I wanted to wish you all Happy Thanksgiving. I am thankful
messages.messageBody:
I know most of you are in the U.S. and some in other places, but it is
Thanksgiving in Canada and I wanted to wish you all Happy Thanksgiving. I
am thankful every day for the people on this list who have made me really
think about unschooling and have helped change our lives for the better.

Donna in Nova Scotia, full of pumpkin pie :-)

messages.messageBody:

Janis

Hi,
I saw you guys talking about getting together janis, and chris and
there was some other name mentioned but I can't remember brain cramp.
Anyway, as far as finding unschoolers I'm in your area of the woods.
Attleboro,Mass.
Please fill me in on what you decide :)
Thanks ,
Sonya

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] finding unschoolers
messages.msgSnippet: ***Of course, NO ONE showed up from MONTANA, Deb....*** Hey!  If I d know I was the official state representative I could have put on my old high school cheer
messages.messageBody:
***Of course, NO ONE showed up from MONTANA, Deb....***

Hey! If I'd know I was the official state representative I could have
put on my old high school cheer leading uniform and gone round my
neighborhood selling zucchinis to raise money!

Wait. I was never a cheerleader.
Never mind.

Deb, gone round the bend, instead.

To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, October 03, 2003 9:09 PM
Subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: finding unschoolers


Janis, you're in RI, too? I think because of your screen name (Coyote) I thought you lived somewhere out west. We really need to do a southern New England unschool day since there are so many of us. It's getting so cold. Where would we go?

Crystal

From: coyote's corner
To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com

To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, October 03, 2003 8:36 PM
Subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: finding unschoolers


I'm sorry Cris, I was talking about locally. You live too far away. How have you been? One day we'll have a second car and we'll get together.

For everyone else: Yes, I met Cris, an unschooler, while looking for a ride to the conference. She answered my post and we carpooled down there. If it wasn't for her generosity, I would have never made it there. She's really cool, too. We found a great radio station on the way home and we sang at the top of our lungs while stuck in traffic.

Crystal

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] finding unschoolers
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/3/2003 3:34:14 PM Eastern Daylight Time, UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes: You would be surprised how far unschoolers are
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/3/2003 3:34:14 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes:
You would be surprised how far unschoolers are willing to travel to meet
other unschoolers.
Pam G<<<

Right. To Columbia, SC from California and Oregon and Colorado and Arizona
and Ohio and New York and Louisiana and Illinois and Missouri and Maryland and
Massachusetts and New Mexico and Minnesota and Michigan and Florida and North
Carolina and Georgia and Virginia and CANADA and GERMANY!

Of course, NO ONE showed up from MONTANA, Deb....

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] finding unschoolers
messages.msgSnippet: ... Where does one find these? I met one unschooler in my town group where I just moved to.  She had been an unschooler in the beginning but as her kids got
messages.messageBody:
>>>>make an effort to be around other unschooled kids, older than yours,
>>
Where does one find these?>>>

I met one unschooler in my town group where I just moved to. She had been an unschooler in the beginning but as her kids got older she began assimilating into the school-at-home group and became more eclectic. I knew she was an unschooler-at-heart by the way she talked so I asked her about it. She never goes on the internet so she had no other unschoolers near her so she's glad I am in the group now.

I met a second unschooler in the video store here. I saw her get out of a van that was painted like tie dye so that peaked my curiosity about her. I saw her looking at movies with her probably 8 or 9 year old daughter wrapped around her waist. I knew for sure then that she was one of us. I approached her and asked her if she was an unschooler. She was (of course). Unfortunately she was in the process of moving to another state because it would have been cool to get to know her. BTW, it was her kids who painted her van. She bought a whole bunch of spray paint and let them do it.

Crystal

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: finding unschoolers
messages.msgSnippet: ... unschooled kids, older than yours, and see if you think they re growing up okay. ... Where does one find these? I should mention that the vast majority of
messages.messageBody:
>>>>If you worry about your children, make an effort to be around other
unschooled kids, older than yours, and see if you think they're growing
up okay.

>>
Where does one find these? I should mention that the vast majority of my
city is made up of those "fundamentalist Christian Homeschoolers" ya'll
have been back and forth about. In fact, I've never even met a
homeschooler in my city that didn't homeschool for religious reasons and
our local organization (and fair cooridinators) are all of the same
mindset. I'm so glad that I had the computer! If it weren't for a bunch
of great women who couldn't see that I was wearing a denim skirt and
spoke to my mind/words instead, I'd probably be still desperately trying
to get out of my box. I'm not practiced in knowing how to find real life
women outside the box..... where to start?<<<

Start you own on-line unschoolers group. I did that (and it turned into an
international conference! <G> I had 350 of my closest virtual unschooling
buddies descend on me one weekend! <G>).

I talked a couple of NC unschoolers into doing it---and within a WEEK, they
had 49 unschoolers on their list! The Greenville unschoolers did it----and
hosted a picnic in the mountains this past Tuesday----FIFTEEN unschooling
families showed up---SOOOO COOL!

Post the info about your new e-list on all state/city-wide e-lists. Put up
flyers at the local food co-op, natural food store,libraries---places YOU hang
out and places where unschoolers might hang out.

If you plan it, they will come!

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
